# Good First Issues Guide

## üéØ Overview

This repository has curated "Good First Issue" templates to help new contributors get started. These issues are designed to be:

- **Well-defined** with clear acceptance criteria
- **Low-risk** changes that don't require deep system knowledge
- **Impactful** improvements that benefit the project
- **Educational** opportunities to learn the codebase and workflows

## üìã Available Good First Issues

### 1. Add Repository Topics + About Blurb
**File**: `.github/ISSUE_TEMPLATE/good-first-issue-repo-metadata.md`  
**Skills**: GitHub settings, documentation, SEO  
**Time**: ~10 minutes  
**Type**: No code changes

**What you'll do:**
- Add relevant topics to the GitHub repository
- Update the About section with a concise description
- Improve repository discoverability

**Good for**: First-time contributors who want to learn about the project without coding.

---

### 2. CONTRIBUTING ‚Äî Local Dev in 5 Minutes Verification
**File**: `.github/ISSUE_TEMPLATE/good-first-issue-contributing-verification.md`  
**Skills**: Testing, documentation, troubleshooting  
**Time**: ~15-20 minutes  
**Type**: Documentation improvement

**What you'll do:**
- Test the local development setup from scratch
- Document any issues or missing steps
- Suggest improvements to the setup process

**Good for**: Contributors who want to understand the development workflow and improve onboarding.

---

### 3. README ‚Äî Badge Alt Text + Link Check
**File**: `.github/ISSUE_TEMPLATE/good-first-issue-readme-badges.md`  
**Skills**: Accessibility, markdown, documentation  
**Time**: ~15 minutes  
**Type**: Documentation + accessibility

**What you'll do:**
- Audit README badges for accessibility
- Improve alt text for screen readers
- Verify badge links work correctly

**Good for**: Contributors interested in accessibility and documentation quality.

---

### 4. Add Keyboard-Focus A11y Smoke Test (Optional)
**File**: `.github/ISSUE_TEMPLATE/good-first-issue-a11y-button-test.md`  
**Skills**: TypeScript, React, Testing, Accessibility  
**Time**: ~30-45 minutes  
**Type**: Code + testing

**What you'll do:**
- Create a simple smoke test for keyboard focus
- Verify buttons are keyboard-accessible
- Learn the testing patterns used in the project

**Good for**: Contributors who want to learn testing and accessibility practices.

---

## üöÄ How to Use These Templates

### For Maintainers

1. **Create issues from templates:**
   ```bash
   # Navigate to the repository on GitHub
   # Click "Issues" ‚Üí "New Issue"
   # Select one of the "Good First Issue" templates
   # Review and submit the issue
   ```

2. **Label the issues:**
   - Apply the `good first issue` label
   - Add relevant labels (e.g., `documentation`, `accessibility`, `testing`)
   - Consider adding `help wanted` if you need contributors

3. **Welcome contributors:**
   - Be responsive to questions on the issues
   - Provide guidance when requested
   - Celebrate completed contributions!

### For Contributors

1. **Find good first issues:**
   ```
   https://github.com/CrisisCore-Systems/pain-tracker/issues?q=is%3Aissue+is%3Aopen+label%3A%22good+first+issue%22
   ```

2. **Before starting:**
   - Read the issue carefully and understand the acceptance criteria
   - Comment on the issue to claim it (e.g., "I'd like to work on this!")
   - Ask questions if anything is unclear

3. **While working:**
   - Follow the instructions in the issue template
   - Refer to the linked resources
   - Test your changes thoroughly

4. **When submitting:**
   - Reference the issue in your PR (e.g., "Closes #123")
   - Include screenshots if applicable
   - Request a review from maintainers

---

## üí° Tips for Success

### For Contributors

- **Start simple**: Choose the issue that matches your comfort level
- **Ask questions**: Better to ask than to guess‚Äîmaintainers are here to help!
- **Take your time**: Good first issues are about learning, not speed
- **Read the docs**: Check `CONTRIBUTING.md`, `README.md`, and linked resources
- **Test everything**: Make sure your changes work before submitting

### For Maintainers

- **Be welcoming**: Remember everyone was a beginner once
- **Provide context**: Explain *why* something matters, not just *what* to do
- **Be patient**: First-time contributors may need more guidance
- **Celebrate wins**: Acknowledge completed contributions publicly
- **Update templates**: If issues arise, improve the templates for future contributors

---

## üéØ Success Criteria for Good First Issues

All good first issues should have:

- ‚úÖ Clear, specific acceptance criteria
- ‚úÖ Step-by-step instructions or guidance
- ‚úÖ Links to relevant resources and documentation
- ‚úÖ Examples of what success looks like
- ‚úÖ Estimated time to complete
- ‚úÖ Skills required clearly stated
- ‚úÖ Tips and bonus points for going further
- ‚úÖ Contact information for getting help

---

## ü§ù Getting Help

If you're stuck or have questions:

1. **Comment on the issue** - Maintainers will respond
2. **Check Discussions** - Someone may have had the same question
3. **Review similar PRs** - See how others approached similar tasks
4. **Ask in the PR** - Include specific questions when you submit

Remember: There are no silly questions. We're all learning together! üíú

---

## üìù Creating New Good First Issues

When creating new good first issues, use this template structure:

```markdown
---
name: "Good First Issue: [Brief Description]"
about: [What the contributor will accomplish]
title: "[Good First Issue] [Specific task]"
labels: ["good first issue", "[additional labels]"]
assignees: ''
---

## üéØ Goal
[Clear statement of what this accomplishes]

## üìã Background
[Why this matters / context]

## ‚úÖ Acceptance Criteria
[Checkbox list of specific requirements]

## üõ†Ô∏è How to Complete
[Step-by-step instructions]

## üìö Resources
[Links to relevant docs, examples, etc.]

## üí° Tips
[Helpful hints for success]

## ü§ù Need Help?
[Where to ask questions]
```
